text: the reality is that intercepting a
supersonic ballistic missile hurling
through the sky is anything but simple
let alone foolproof for starters how far
and how fast a missile can go varies
widely
there's short-range medium-range
intermediate range then of course the
intercontinental ballistic missile or
ICBM the system protecting the
continental US is called ground-based
mid-course defense it has 44
interceptors in Alaska and California at
a track record that might keep you up at
night in a team test launches since 1999
target missiles have been hit only 10
times what's the problem a tough target
the systems aim to destroy ICBMs which
fly far higher and faster than lower
range missiles experts say it's like
trying to hit a bullet with a bullet but
a bullet traveling 20 times the speed of
sound three times higher than the
International Space Station the task is
further complicated by the flurry of
debris released when the nuclear warhead
separates from the rest of the missile
in space differentiating the warhead
from the debris in the threat cloud is
difficult experts say even a newer
nuclear power like North Korea is
capable of using decoys or multiple
missiles to confuse the system and
against advanced ICBMs from China or
Russia it wouldn't stand a chance might
not inspire confidence but right now
it's the only system protecting the US
[Music]
